clinical-genetics.description: Clinical genetics databases and rare disease evidence from ClinGen, ClinVar, Genomics England PanelApp, Orphanet, and Gene2Phenotype. Provides clinical validity of gene-disease relationships, pathogenic variants, and clinical genomics panels.

literature-evidence.description: Scientific literature and bibliographic data from Europe PMC and UniProt, including disease and drug bibliographies. Supports text-mined evidence and citation networks.

cancer-genomics.description: Cancer-specific genomic evidence from Cancer Gene Census, IntOGen, cancer biomarkers databases, and cancer hallmarks. Identifies cancer driver genes and somatic mutations.

experimental-models.description: Experimental model organism data including CRISPR knockout screens, mouse phenotypes from IMPC, cancer cell line dependency from DepMap, and chemical probes. Provides functional validation data from laboratory experiments.

validation-evidence.description: Target validation and drug discovery project evidence including validation experiments, Open Targets projects, and TEP (Target Enabling Package) data. Shows experimental support for therapeutic hypotheses.

gwas-associations.description: Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and trait associations. Returns GWAS summary statistics, shared trait studies, and disease-associated genetic variants from population-scale studies.

qtl-genetics.description: Quantitative trait loci (QTL) studies including eQTL, pQTL, and other molecular QTL. Shows how genetic variation affects gene expression, protein levels, and other molecular phenotypes.

credible-sets.description: Fine-mapping results and credible set analysis from GWAS and QTL studies. Includes locus-to-gene predictions, colocalization analyses, and probabilistic identification of causal variants.

variant-annotation.description: Variant functional annotation and population genetics. Includes variant effect predictions (VEP), European Variation Archive data, UniProt variant annotations, and predicted functional consequences of genetic variation.

genetic-constraint.description: Genetic constraint metrics and gene burden analysis. Measures selection pressure on genes including loss-of-function intolerance, showing which genes are essential for survival.

drug-indications.description: Approved and investigational drug indications, clinical trial phases, mechanism-based predictions for drug repurposing, and known drug-disease relationships.

drug-mechanisms.description: Drug mechanisms of action and target interactions from ChEMBL, including drug-target relationships, polypharmacology profiles, and molecular mechanisms of therapeutic effects.

drug-safety.description: Post-market drug safety and pharmacovigilance data from FDA FAERS, including adverse events, drug warnings, and safety alerts for approved medications.

pharmacogenomics.description: Genetic variation affecting drug response, including gene-drug interactions, genotype-dependent efficacy or toxicity, and personalized medicine applications.

target-safety.description: Target safety liabilities and toxicity predictions based on adverse events, animal toxicology, and clinical safety flags. Assesses potential risks of modulating a therapeutic target.

target-tractability.description: Target druggability and tractability assessments, including small molecule and antibody tractability predictions. Evaluates the likelihood of successfully developing drugs against a target.

protein-structure.description: Protein structure, domains, and subcellular localization data. Includes 3D structures, ProtVista features, molecular structure predictions, and structural annotations.

molecular-interactions.description: Protein-protein interactions and molecular networks for understanding biological context, cellular pathways, and functional relationships between biomolecules.

comparative-genomics.description: Cross-species comparative genomics and orthology relationships for leveraging model organism data. Shows evolutionary conservation and functional predictions based on homology.

functional-genomics.description: Gene expression, biological pathways, and systems biology data from Expression Atlas, Reactome, Gene Ontology, and PROGENy. Provides context on gene function, regulation, and pathway involvement.

disease-phenotypes.description: Disease phenotypes, symptoms, and ontology for understanding clinical manifestations, disease classifications, and relationships between different conditions.

disease-associations.description: Target-disease association evidence and prioritization, integrating evidence across multiple data types. Shows the strength of association between genes/targets and diseases.

entity-profiles.description: Entity profile pages providing comprehensive summaries for diseases, targets, drugs, variants, and studies. Single-page views aggregating all available information for a specific entity.

entity-search.description: Cross-entity search and entity discovery across all entity types with keyword search capabilities. Enables finding targets, diseases, drugs, variants, and studies by name or identifier.
